articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Demonstration Figure Skating Performance (Urgent)
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Demonstration Figure Skating Performance (Urgent)

					Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, enjoyed a demonstration figure skating performance.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Demonstration Figure Skating Performance
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Demonstration Figure Skating Performance

					Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, enjoyed a demonstration figure skating performance.
					
					Figure skaters successfully presented refined skills such as graceful and soft movements and skilful spins and jumps in their group performance, male and female numbers, ice dance and pair demonstration performance. Their program included "Fortune of Korea", "Thought of General", "Song of Gypsy," "Rich Harvest Comes to the Chongsan Plain", "Thunder over Jong Il Peak", "Sound in Spring", "The Country I Am Defending" and "Glory to Our Great Party".
					
					Kim Jong Il expressed great satisfaction over the successful demonstration figure skating performances the players presented with graceful rhythms meeting the national aesthetic need and a high level of difficult movements. He extended thanks to them.
					
					He gave instructions which would serve as guidelines for further developing the figure skating.
					
					He said that in order to develop figure skating it is necessary to provide good conditions, environment and equipment for training and harmoniously combine music and costume and music and movements.
					
					Developing sports including figure skating is of very weighty significance in preparing all the people so that they may contribute to the labor and defence with strong physical bodies, demonstrating the dignity and honor of Juche Korea and developing the friendly relations with various countries of the world, he said.
					
					He stressed the need for the sportspersons to acquire Korean-style figure skating technique and training methods, create peculiar figure skating and ice dances as required by the new century and register great successes in international arena and thus fully demonstrate the honor of Songun Korea and the Korean people's spirit.
					
					He also acquainted himself with the management and operation of the Ice Rink.
					
					He stressed the need to raise the utility rate of the Ice Rink which can host ice games including hockey and figure skating all the year round so that young people and children may visit it to train their physical bodies. To do so the Ice Rink should be modernly face-lifted as required by the Songun era, he added.
					
					Among the spectators were senior officials of the party and armed forces organs Kim Jong Un, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Kim Kyong Hui, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Yang Gon, Pak To Chun, Kim Phyong Hae, Thae Jong Su, Mun Kyong Dok, U Tong Chuk and Ri Myong Su, KPA Generals Kim Won Hong, Pak Jae Gyong, Ri Pyong Chol, Yun Jong Rin and Hyon Chol Hae, servicepersons and officials in the fields of literature and art, media and sports.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Kaeson Youth Park Funfair (Urgent)
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Kaeson Youth Park Funfair (Urgent)

					Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, went round the Kaeson Youth Park Funfair to learn about its management and operation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Kaeson Youth Park Funfair
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Kaeson Youth Park Funfair

					Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, went round the Kaeson Youth Park Funfair to learn about its management and operation.
					
					Walking round different places of the funfair meeting the modern aesthetic need, he acquainted himself in detail with its management and operation.
					
					In order to learn about the operation of amusement facilities, he let officials accompanying him ride on a merry-go-round, a triple giant stride, nose diving tower and switchback. He was pleased to hear that all the amusement facilities are good ones which help children and school youth and students cultivate valor and bravery and old people enjoy a joyful life. 
					
					Then he dropped in at a kiosk in the compound of the funfair serving wheat cake stuffed with roast chicken to learn about its nutrients and price.
					
					He was greatly  satisfied to know that the officials of the Guidance Bureau of Mt. Taesong, the General Bureau for Service for People, the August 28 Foreign Trade Administration Bureau and other relevant fields are regularly operating the amusement facilities and letting various catering networks render good service in the spirit of devoted service for the people.
					
					He set forth the tasks to be fulfilled to manage and operate the funfair. 
					
					What is most important for managing and operating the funfair is to conduct check-up and control of the amusement facilities in a responsible way, he said. 
					
					It is necessary to strengthen the technical control of equipment and steadily improve their operation so that visitors may feel not the slightest inconvenience, he noted.
					
					It is also necessary to spruce up the funfair ground well to make it match its environment, he added. 
					
					He underscored the need to provide sufficient quantities of foodstuff and other things to the catering networks in the funfair to operate them more effectively. 
					
					Deeply moved by the profound loving care the leader showed for the people by spending even Sunday to make the people's life happier, the officials and other workers of the funfair firmly pledged themselves to get more cheerful laughter of people heard in the park as wished by him.
					
					Accompanying him were Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the WPK Central Military Commission, Ri Yong Ho, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., WPK and chief of the General Staff of the KPA, Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., WPK, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC, Choe Ryong Hae and Kim Phyong Hae, alternate members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., WPK, U Tong Chuk, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., WPK, Ri Myong Su, minister of People's Security, and Kim Kyong Ok, first vice department director of the C.C., WPK.

articles.title: Greetings to Thai King
articles.content:
Greetings to Thai King

					Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of greeting to Bhumibol Adulyadej, king of Thailand, on his birthday and national day of the country.
					
					Kim in the message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, wishing the king good health and the Thai people progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Thai PM
articles.content:
Greetings to Thai PM

					Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- DPRK premier Choe Yong Rim Sunday sent a message of greeting to Yingluck Shinawatra, prime minister of Thailand, on its national day.
					
					Choe in the message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the common interests of the peoples of the two countries, wishing the prime minister and the Thai people success in their work for the country's development and prosperity.
					
					Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent similar message to his Thai counterpart Surapong Towijakchaikul on the same day.

articles.title: South-South Cooperation among Developing Countries Called for: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
South-South Cooperation among Developing Countries Called for: Rodong Sinmun

					Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- To stand against sanctions imposed by imperialists from every angle presents itself as an important issue for independent countries against imperialism.
					
					Rodong Sinmun Sunday says this in a bylined article.
					
					Those countries which broke through the imperialists' siege and sanctions did not fall victim to the wars of aggression but those countries which failed to do so fell prey to them without an exception, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					Confrontation with them means political, military and economic standoff and do-or-die struggle.
					
					In order to win victory in this standoff it is important to have strong political and military muscle as well as economic might.
					
					Strong economy guarantees political and military power and ensures a victory in the confrontation with the imperialists. Weak economy makes it impossible to hold fast to independent stand in the political standoff, forcing those countries to face a miserable plight, subject to humiliation by the imperialists' isolation and sanctions.
					
					Countries aspiring after independence against imperialism have to build self-supporting national economy in order to frustrate imperialists' moves to isolate and stifle them and impose sanctions on them.
					
					Only self-supporting national economy will help overcome difficulties by one's own efforts and technology, remaining unperturbed by the imperialists' sanctions.
					
					South-south cooperation is the best way for the developing countries to pool efforts. They can successfully foil the imperialists' sanctions when they develop economy by filling each other's economic need on the principle of collective self-reliance.
					
					Recently the economy of developing countries has outpaced developed ones. Bygone are the times when the imperialists boasted of their military strength and economic and technical advantages.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Rhetoric about "Flexibility of North Policy" under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Rhetoric about "Flexibility of North Policy" under Fire

					Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea Sunday gave the following answer to the question put by KCNA as regards the south Korean authorities' intensified moves for confrontation and war behind the scene of "flexibility of north policy": 
					
					The south Korean conservative authorities have recently vociferated about "flexibility of north policy" in a bid to give impression that they are interested in the improvement of the north-south relations. 
					
					They said that the flexibility is to "ease the inter-Korean relations and defuse the tension" and that they expect that "the north would positively respond to their sincere efforts". 
					
					This is shameless and deceptive sophism and intolerable mockery and insult to the south Korean people and all other fellow countrymen hoping for the north-south dialogue and improvement of the relations. 
					
					Their talk about the "flexibility of north policy" is an empty talk, and nothing has changed in their confrontation policy. 
					
					They have become all the more intent on the anti-DPRK smear campaign and war moves, persistently finding fault with the nuclear issue and "Cheonan" warship and Yonphyong Island shelling cases. 
					
					They have kicked up together with outside forces anti-DPRK campaign over the nuclear issue while standing in the way of resuming the six-party talks for the peaceful settlement of the nuclear issue of the Korean Peninsula. They are driving the situation to the extreme phase while working with blood-shot eyes to make military provocations against the north. 
					
					It is none other than the puppet Ministry of Unification that has desperately checked the contacts, exchanges and cooperation between NGOs of the north and the south including organizations for implementing the June 15 joint declaration and meddled in the humanitarian projects under the pretence of "May 24 measures". 
					
					Their anti-DPRK campaign over the human rights issue and sinister daydream of confrontation of systems have reached the reckless phase. 
					
					Not content with their rhetoric about the theory of "defending principles" at home, they noisily advocated this theory outside. They unhesitatingly let loose confrontation remarks that they would not opt for improvement of inter-Korean relations unless there is a change in the north's attitude. It is ridiculous for them to talk about the flexibility. Their shamelessness shocked everyone.
					
					It is quite natural that the south Korean people from all walks of life and public opinion at home and abroad strongly demand a switchover in their confrontation policy denouncing the deceptiveness of their talk about the flexibility. 
					
					The "flexibility of north policy" touted by the puppet group is nothing but hypocrisy to cover up their purpose for confrontation. It is also rhetoric aimed to convince the public that they are interested in the improvement of the north-south relations, divert public criticism and tide over ruling crisis. 
					
					All facts show that for the wagon of the "north policy" to take right path it is prerequisite to replace the carter, not just horse.
					
					The true colors of the "flexibility" have been brought to light. The puppet group is gravely mistaken if it thinks it can deceive the public and mislead the opinion with such foolish and ridiculous trick.
					
					No matter how desperately the puppet group may cling to the threadbare confrontation policy behind the smokescreen of "flexibility" it will get them nowhere. 
					
					It should clearly understand that it can neither expect improved north-south relations nor save its destiny unless it makes a fundamental change in its confrontation attitude to the DPRK.

articles.title: Preparatory Committees for Celebrating Kim Jong Il's Birthday Inaugurated
articles.content:
Preparatory Committees for Celebrating Kim Jong Il's Birthday Inaugurated

					Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Preparatory committees for celebrating February 16, the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il, in 2012 were inaugurated in Ukraine and Egypt.
					
					An inaugural ceremony held in Ukraine on November 29 elected Pro. and Dr. of Kiev University Gennadi Berdishev chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					Earlier to it, the Egyptian preparatory committee that was formed on November 26 elected Egyptian Vice-Minister of Agriculture Muhammad al Husseini al Akad chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					The preparatory committees decided to organize colorful political and cultural events including rally, seminar, photo exhibition and film show to mark the February holiday.

articles.title: American Organization Supports Just Cause of Korean People
articles.content:
American Organization Supports Just Cause of Korean People

					Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The North American Group for Study of the Juche and Songun Philosophy of the U.S. released a statement on November 25 in support of the just cause of the Korean people.
					
					It voiced support to the Democratic People's Republic of Korea fighting against the moves of the south Korean warmongers.
					
					It expressed absolute solidarity with the government and people of the DPRK exposed to the grave danger created on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					Anyone who pursues truth would know well that the south Korean warmongers recklessly preempted fire into the territorial waters of the DPRK from Yonphyong Island last year, it said, adding:
					
					This provocation against the DPRK prompted the Korean People's Army to take retaliatory strike as a just self-defensive measure.
					
					The DPRK has consistently made efforts for peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					We demand the south Korean authorities renounce the military exercises and implement the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					We support measures taken by the DPRK for defending the sovereignty, and extend military solidarity to the army and people of the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Songun Leadership Feats Praised by British Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Songun Leadership Feats Praised by British Organization

					Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy on Nov. 19 posted on its Internet homepage article titled "Defending world peace with outstanding Songun leadership" with a photo of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					World people are praising him as the "great defender of the socialist cause" and "symbol of human cause of peace", the article said, and went on:
					
					The imperialists have resorted to vicious moves such as political and diplomatic pressure, economic blockade and armed blackmail to harm the DPRK.
					
					Tricksters of the U.S. Department of Defense made a Korean war a fait accompli and worked out an operation scenario.
					
					Another war might break out on the Korean Peninsula any moment.
					
					The international community closely watched the DPRK with deep concern.
					
					But for the Songun politics, a war would have broken out long ago on the Korean Peninsula by the imperialist aggressors and humankind would have been plunged into disastrous calamities of world war again.
					
					Kim Jong Il conducted the energetic external activities to defend socialism and world peace.
					
					He visited Russia and China several times in the new century alone. He also met with foreigners who visited the DPRK and gave clear answers to the questions for world peace and security.
					
					It was thanks to his outstanding Songun revolutionary leadership and energetic external activities that all the moves of the imperialists against independence and peace have been checked and frustrated.
					
					Justice and peace are being protected in the international arena and the human cause of independence is dynamically advancing thanks to the peerless Songun brilliant commander.

articles.title: U.S., S. Korea, Japan Should Accept Requirement for Unconditional Resumption of Six-Party Talks
articles.content:
U.S., S. Korea, Japan Should Accept Requirement for Unconditional Resumption of Six-Party Talks

					Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The stalled six-party talks are blamed on the U.S. which raised preconditions for them.
					
					Hirogazu Kitagawa, representative member of the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, said this speaking at the 29th national meeting of the movement for supporting Korea's reunification on Nov. 26.
					
					The demand for the DPRK's "scrap of nuclear program first" is in breach of the September 19 joint statement based on the principle of simultaneous actions, he noted.
					
					The U.S., south Korea and Japan should retract preconditions and accept the requirement for unconditional resumption of the six-party talks, the shortcut to the denuclearization and peace on the Korean Peninsula, he stressed.
					
					The U.S. forces in Japan and south Korea are the chieftains stoking military tension in East Asia, he said, demanding the U.S. forces vacate their military bases in south Korea and Japan to ensure the peace in the region.
					
					Inevitable to this end is to conclude the DPRK-U.S. peace agreement which will end the war state, and immediately start the talks for signing the agreement, he noted.

articles.title: China Launches 10th Satellite for Independent Navigation System
articles.content:
China Launches 10th Satellite for Independent Navigation System

					Beijing, December 3 (KCNA) -- China successfully launched a satellite into space on Friday, the 10th one of its indigenous global navigation and positioning network known as Beidou, or Compass system, the launch center said.
					
					The satellite, launched from the Xichang Satellite Launch Center in the southwestern Sichuan Province, was boosted by a Long March-3A carrier rocket into a geosynchronous orbit. 
					
					The basic structure of the Beidou system has now been established, and engineers are now conducting comprehensive system test and evaluation.

articles.title: Vietnamese PM Urges More Efforts to Fulfill This Year's Socio-economic Development Goals
articles.content:
Vietnamese PM Urges More Efforts to Fulfill This Year's Socio-economic Development Goals

					Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Vietnamese Prime Minister Nguyen Tan Dung instructed ministries and localities nationwide to show determination to fulfill the country's socio-economic development goals in 2011 when he chaired the cabinet regular meeting on Thursday. 
					
					Monetary policy is a decisive factor in curbing inflation and maintaining growth, he said. 
					
					He urged ministers to strengthen coordination in addressing emerging issues during the implementation of monetary policy as well as measures to control market prices, restrain the trade deficit, mitigate natural disasters and boost administrative reforms, traffic safety and crime prevention.

articles.title: Summit of East African Community Held
articles.content:
Summit of East African Community Held

					Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The summit of the East African Community (EAC) was held in the capital city of Burundi on Nov. 30.
					
					Present there were heads of state and government delegates of the member nations of the EAC and delegates of the African Union, the Common Market for Eastern and Southern Africa (COMESA) and the Southern African Development Community (SADC).
					
					The summit discussed the issues of founding a regional monetary union to cope with the global financial crisis and boosting cooperation in the fields of trade and defense.
					
					It approved the protocol on cooperating in the defense field.

articles.title: India Censures Israeli Settlement Activity
articles.content:
India Censures Israeli Settlement Activity

					Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- India said on Wednesday that the "biggest stumbling block" to direct negotiations for the Middle East peace process is Israeli continued settlement activity in occupied Palestinian territory. 
					
					The statement came as Hardeep Singh Puri, Indian permanent representative to the UN, addressed the General Assembly in a plenary meeting on the question of Palestine. 
					
					"We call upon Israel to stop settlement activities," said Puri.
					
					"It is necessary that direct talks between Israel and Palestine resume without any further delay," said Puri.

articles.title: Indonesia's Exports Rise
articles.content:
Indonesia's Exports Rise

					Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Indonesia's exports in October increased by 16.17 percent year on year, the country's Statistic Bureau announced on Thursday.

articles.title: Brazil's New AIDS Cases Down
articles.content:
Brazil's New AIDS Cases Down

					Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Brazil's new cases of AIDS totaled 34 200 in 2010, down 4.7 percent from 2009, Health Ministry said Monday.
					
					Infection ratio fell from 18.8 for every 100 000 inhabitants to 17.9 in the same period, it added.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region

					Beijing, December 3 (KCNA) -- A 5.2-magnitude earthquake hit the Kas area of Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region, China on Dec. 1.
					
					The epicenter was about 10 km deep in the area. 11 300 persons suffered as of Dec. 2. Relief steps are being taken in the field.

articles.title: Israel Arrests 22 Palestinians in West Bank
articles.content:
Israel Arrests 22 Palestinians in West Bank

					Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The Israeli army arrested 22 Palestinians Thursday in West Bank raids that targeted key members of a Palestinian faction as part of its renewed campaign against Palestinians.

articles.title: U.S. Initial Jobless Claims Continue to Rise
articles.content:
U.S. Initial Jobless Claims Continue to Rise

					Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The number of Americans initially applying for unemployment aid increased last week for the second straight week, the U.S. Labor Department reported Thursday.
					
					The Labor Department said that the advance figure for seasonally adjusted initial claims for jobless benefits was 402 000 in the week ending Nov. 26, an increase of 6 000 from the previous week's revised figure.

articles.title: High Levels of Cesium Found in Port Soil at Fukushima Daiichi Plant
articles.content:
High Levels of Cesium Found in Port Soil at Fukushima Daiichi Plant

					Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- High levels of radioactive cesium have been detected in seabed soil at the port by the crippled Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant in Fukushima Prefecture, according to survey data Thursday.
					
					Soil samples taken at nine spots at the plant port in late November contained as many as 870 000 becquerels of cesium-137 per kilogram of soil and 730 000 becquerels of cesium-134 per kilogram of soil.

articles.title: Windstorm Hits U.S.
articles.content:
Windstorm Hits U.S.

					Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- A strong windstorm lashed Southern California, the United States, on Dec. 1, leaving some 300 000 residents without power and forcing many schools to close.
					
					Roads were blocked due to traffic accidents and a large number of flights diverted to other airports.

articles.title: World Economy at Risk of 2nd Recession: UN Report
articles.content:
World Economy at Risk of 2nd Recession: UN Report

					Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The global economy, troubled by many interconnected problems, risks entering another major downturn, according to a chapter of a report by the UN Department of Social and Economic Affairs released Thursday. 
					
					The global economy is likely to be at risk of second recession due to the high unemployment, debt crisis in eurozone and austerity policies in developed countries, the report said.
